data.name: SettingsError.Text
data.value: Could not update the settings. Please try later.

data.name: SettingsRestoreWarning.Text
data.value: Are you sure you want to cancel your changes?

data.name: lblTenantId.Error
data.value: You must specify the Microsoft Tenant ID

data.name: lblTenantId.Help
data.value: Microsoft tenant ID. For single-tenant apps, this can be: the guid of your directory; the directory name in the format mycompany.onmicrosoft.com; the default custom domain name being used in the tenant, i.e. mycompany.com. For multi-tenant scenarios, type "common" to allow the provider to use the common endpoint authorization url.

data.name: lblAppId.Error
data.value: You must specify your application ID

data.name: lblAppId.Help
data.value: The unique identifier for the application

data.name: lblAppSecret.Error
data.value: You must specify a secret key

data.name: lblAutoRedirect.Help
data.value: If enabled, the login page will automatically redirect to the Microsoft Entra ID login page

data.name: lblEnabled.Help
data.value: Enables the Microsoft Entra ID authentication provider for this portal

data.name: lblTabDescription.Text
data.value: The Microsoft Entra ID Provider is an Authentication provider that uses Microsoft Entra ID OAuth2 authentication to authenticate users.

data.name: InvalidAadClaimName.Text
data.value: You have to type a valid Entra ID claim name

data.name: lblAADAppClientId.Error
data.value: You must specify the Application ID

data.name: lblAADAppClientId.Help
data.value: The Application ID (it's used to sync user data)

data.name: lblAADAppSecret.Error
data.value: You must especify the application key

data.name: lblAADAppSecret.Help
data.value: A valid key for the Application

data.name: lblAadPropertyName.Help
data.value: This is the Entra ID property against which the user property will be mapped.

data.name: lblAPIResourceDesc.Text
data.value: If you are going to use the issued tokens to access an external WebAPI that uses Microsoft Entra ID Authorization, you can specify the App ID URI and scopes that will be validated by the WebAPI

data.name: lblAppIdUri.Help
data.value: The App ID Uri of the external WebAPI, obtained from the Azure portal (i.e. https://mytenant.onmicrosoft.com/myapi/)

data.name: lblAudiences.Help
data.value: Introduce the audiences to validate JWT tokens, separated by commas. If left empty, the Application Id will be used by default.

data.name: lblDnnProfilePropertyName.Help
data.value: The user profile property you want to map with a Entra ID claim

data.name: lblDnnPropertyName.Help
data.value: This is the user property that is going to be mapped against a Entra ID property

data.name: lblDnnRoleName.Help
data.value: The local role you want to map with a Entra ID role

data.name: lblDnnUserPropertyName.Help
data.value: The user property you want to map with a Entra ID claim

data.name: lblGraphClient.Help
data.value: A Tenant ID, an Application ID and an Application Secret are needed to use the Microsoft Graph API. By default, the ones introduced in General Settings will be used, but you can also specify different ones.

data.name: lblGroupNamePrefixEnabled.Help
data.value: Enables the addition of the prefix "Azure-" to all group names coming from Microsoft Entra.

data.name: lblNamePrefixes.Help
data.value: By default, all users and groups coming from Microsoft Entra will contain the prefix "Azure-". The following two options allow you to disable the addition of that prefix

data.name: lblProfileSyncEnabled.Help
data.value: Enables the profile synchronization for this portal

data.name: lblRemoveExpiredRoleMembershipsEnabled.Help
data.value: When enabled, users with expired role memberships in DNN will be removed from corresponding groups in Entra ID during synchronization

data.name: lblRemoveExpiredRoleMembershipsEnabled.Text
data.value: Remove Expired Role Memberships from Entra ID

data.name: lblRedirectUri.Help
data.value: If specified, the redirect uri after a successful login. By default (blank), the user will be redirected to the page originating the login redirection.

data.name: lblRedirectUri.Error
data.value: You must specify a full, valid HTTPS or localhost URL

data.name: lblOnErrorUri.Help
data.value: If specified, when an Microsoft Entra auth error happens the user is redirected to the url instead of showing the default login page.

data.name: lblRoleSyncEnabled.Help
data.value: Enables the role synchronization for this portal

data.name: lblScopes.Help
data.value: The scopes separated by spaces, that will be include in the issued tokens, to be validated by the external WebAPI (i.e. "read write")

data.name: lblSynchronizationDesc.Text
data.value: The synchronization process can automatically sync roles, users and profiles from your Microsoft Entra tenant into your portal. This can affect login performance.

data.name: lblTabDescription.Text1
data.value: The Microsoft Entra ID Provider is an Authentication provider that uses Microsoft Entra ID OAuth2 authentication to authenticate users.

data.name: lblTokenValidation.Help
data.value: This provider supports JWT authorization. You can get a JWT token directly from the Microsoft Entra API with your desired audiences, and then call a WebAPI controller. Below you can specify different settings to validate issued tokens.

data.name: lblUseGlobalSettings.Help
data.value: If enabled, all the settings are applied to all portals on this deployment. Only Super Users can edit this setting

data.name: lblUsernamePrefixEnabled.Help
data.value: Enables the addition of the prefix "Azure-" to all user names coming from Microsoft Entra.

data.name: MappingDeletedWarning.Text
data.value:
Are you sure you want to delete this mapping?
Microsoft Entra users will remain in the local role

data.name: NamePrefixesWarningMessage.Text
data.value: Warning: If these settings change, all users who have already been synchronized will be synchronized again with their new usernames after the next login, leaving the old ones in the system.

data.name: ProfileMappingDeletedWarning.Text
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete this mapping?

data.name: lblAutoAuthorize.Help
data.value: If enabled, automatically authorize users after login independently of the portal user registration settings

data.name: lblAadRoleName.Help
data.value: The Microsoft Entra Role name to map

data.name: lblAuthorizationCodePrompt.Help
data.value:
Indicates the type of user interaction that is required. The default behavior is to either sign in the sole current user, show the account picker if there are multiple users, or show the login page if there are no users signed in.
[login] forces the user to enter their credentials on that request, negating single-sign on.
[none] is the opposite. It ensures that the user isn't presented with any interactive prompt. If the request can't be completed silently by using single-sign on, the Microsoft identity platform returns an interaction_required error.
[consent] triggers the OAuth consent dialog after the user signs in, asking the user to grant permissions to the app.
[select_account] interrupts single sign-on providing account selection experience listing all the accounts either in session or any remembered account or an option to choose to use a different account altogether.

data.name: lblAuthorizationCodeDomainHint.Help
data.value: If included, the app skips the email-based discovery process that user goes through on the sign-in page, leading to a slightly more streamlined user experience.

data.name: lblUserSyncEnabled.Help
data.value: Enables the user synchronization for this portal

data.name: lblAutoMatchExistingUsers.Help
data.value: If enabled, when signing in with Microsoft Entra by providing a username identical to an existing user created locally, will automatically bind that user to the Microsoft Entra one.

data.name: lblUseCustomParameters.Help
data.value: If enabled, the Microsoft Graph API will use the values specified in this section. Otherwise, it will use the ones in specified in General Settings.
